Award.AwardTitle: IEEE Symposium on Foundations of Computer Science (FOCS) 2012, New Brunswick, New Jersey Oct 19-23, 2012

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations

Award.AbstractNarration: This award will help to support student attendance at the 53rd IEEE Annual Symposium on the Foundations of Computer Science (FOCS) in New Brunswick, New Jersey, on October 19 through October 23, 2012, as well as to support attendance by some qualified postdoctoral fellows who do not have other sources of travel funding. FOCS and its sister conference, the ACM STOC meeting, are the premier broad-based conferences on the Theory of Computing. FOCS has a record of strongly encouraging participation by students, for whom the conference serves as a valuable educational experience, both for the technical content of the talks and for the opportunities for networking that it provides. In recent years, the annual FOCS conference has been attended by eighty to one hundred students who have comprised more than a third of all attendees. This award will provide partial support to twenty or more students, covering shared hotel rooms and travel. (Student registration will be supported by other means.)

ProgramElement.Text: Inter Com Sci Econ Soc S (ICE)

POR.DRECONTENT:
This was a travel grant to support needy students and postdoctoral scholars at U.S. institutions to attend FOCS (Foundations of Computer Science)  2012 conference that was held in New Brunswick, New Jersey on October 19-23, 2012 . Due to a large number of requests for funds from students and postdoctoral scholars from a large number of universities across US, every effort was made to economize and provide smaller travel grants, yet provide reasonable travel awards, including requesting shared accommodations and requesting shared rides to the conference whenever applicable. Overall, this was a very successful effort. Travel grant funded 41 students and postdoctoral scholars to attend FOCS  2012 conference. We actively solicited under-represented and minority groups to apply for funding. We tried to accommodate as many requests as possible, especially from woman and minorities.  The students and postdoctoral scholars benefited from attending FOCS, which is a top tier conference in computer science, by both attending technical talks and by interactive with other conference participants. At the same time, conference participants benefited from the influx of students and postdoctoral scholars interested in the topics and engaging in research. The grant promoted fruitful scientific interactions at the conference - providing to grantees a very rich learning experience.

 

 

 

 


Last Modified: 10/25/2013
Modified by: Rafail Ostrovsky
